Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, very nice staff and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Javier1954
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, with metro and bus stations nearby. The room facilities are good, including the silent air conditioner machine. Good breakfast, with real fresh orange juice and fresh pastries. The cleaning personnel in the 4th floor was really helpful (we needed help and they were extremely effective and nice). My congratulations to the Hotel's manager for having such great staff. Will return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Not flashy but very good and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mungo777Omaha
Reviews.Content: I have a five day stay at this hotel and enjoyed my stay there very good. It is a solid place, not too flashy but has everything you need. Good rooms, very good breakfast, helpful staff, good location right by a metro station. It is also close to the business district and to real Madrid stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round value”
Reviews.Author: sandarab
Reviews.Content: Good location, not too moisy, beds and pillows are comfortable. Good breakfast and ideal for metro and bus travel from the city. All in all this hotel does what it says on the tin .... good value all round.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location if you are in Madrid for business”
Reviews.Author: rgrici
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, clean and very good value for money. It does not have a character and it is certainly a good option if you are in Madrid for business and need to go in the northern part of Madrid. If you are in Madrid for tourism, I would stay more central.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a good location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Ravish D
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Madrid on work and stayed at the Abba Castilla Plaza hotel. The hotel is located extremely conveniently, right opposite the Castilla Plaza Metro Station and the bus stop. Very close by, are a McDonald's cafe and a BurgerKing outlet. So location-wise cannot beat this hotel. My room was tiny, probably coz it was single sharing. I almost climbed up on the bed to put on my pajamas once. Having said that, the house-keeping kept the rooms extremely neat and tidy. Very well stocked mini bar and all necessary trivialities available in the washroom - showercap, dental kit, comb etc etc. A surprise, and a delight for a European hotel. Breakfast was okay - probably good for non-veggies. Couldn't find much on the vegetarian ensemble though. The staff in the day during check-in was extremely polite with a decent sense of humor, much required when you check-in post a 14 hr flight. However most of the front desk execs in the evening/night didn't seem to like their jobs, or their guests much. Although English is about as common in Spain as an action role portrayed by Martin Sheen, the staff here spoke passable English, and pretty much understood all I had to say. One of the girls at the desk, even managed an El Classico, Real Madrid vs Barcelona match ticket for me. The lifts at the hotel are amongst the slowest in Madrid, probably in all of Spain. And they charge a monstrous fee for parking, I couldn't help but notice. Overall, couldn't complain much about the stay here for convenience vs the price I paid. Good value for money for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: Bruno_trips
Reviews.Content: Well, the staff, except for the breakfast ladies, is terrible. From the front desk to the waitresses at the restaurant, it seems like they're doing you a favour. They're rude, period. Arrived at the hotel at 11:30 and I was told there were no rooms available till noon, and that is totally fine and standard procedure all around. I go out for a walk and 12:45 I come back to the hotel and ask the front desk clerk "Is my room ready?". He replies: "No", turns around and hands over the situation to someone else. No biggie, it happens... The other front desk guy checks me in and I go to my room. I turn on the A/C and, almost immediately, water comes down from the ceiling. I turn off the A/C and go to sleep. 3 days later they didn't even bother to give me another bar of soap, shun me because I went out for a smoke late at night and charge me 28 euros for 3 days worth of terrible internet. The pricey internet, A/C problems and soap issues I can live with, it happens everywhere. But the rudeness of the staff is simply unacceptable. I'd rather be farther away from my client and face the Metro every day than to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average - But will go back again”
Reviews.Author: Friendlyface097
Reviews.Content: I stayed on business for 2 weeks at the hotel. The rooms are average. However it appears te infrastructure cannot cope with the number of residents. The breakfast was good and plentiful. However due to large coach parties there were not many tables for breakfast and people had to queue to get a table in the morning - Not very nice. Get down early for breakfast. Also the lifts are not quick and they dont have many. So ensure you dont get a room on the higher floors. I got a room on the 4th floor and was able to walk down when needed. The air-conditioner was leaking and I had to pack a very wet suitcase one friday when leaving for London. The staff we as helpful when I complained. But please check. On the whole the rates were good and the hotel is ok. I would go back there again. YOu get what you pay for and it was reasonably priced and it was good to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Clean, Quiet Oasis in Hot City!”
Reviews.Author: sobaytravelguy
Reviews.Content: I found the Abba Castilla Plaza to be very comfortable, with nice rooms, good A/C, big bathrooms. It is convenient to the Metro. They offer free wifi in the public areas, and also have one terminal for limited free use (10 minutes at a time.) No fitness center. Staff were helpful. Breakfast buffet is good although expensive (as it is throughout Spain). There are several low-cost p[laces right nearby as an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE!! NO WIFI OR AC!”
Reviews.Author: steveg2000
Reviews.Content: Terrible stay have styed here now for at least 20 days this year and it getting worse everytime I visit. Not a business hotel... Wifi not working... Enter card not working... No A/C..

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, not in the center but has a very good price/value balance”
Reviews.Author: sotir_loredana
Reviews.Content: In order to arrive to Abba hotel from Barajas Airport you take the 8 line of the Metro and change at Colombia station. From there take the metro 9 in direction Herrera Oria and exit at Plazza de Castilla. From there is very easy to find the hotel, just behind one of the 2 towers. The check-in was done easily. It helps if you know spanish, but with english is fine also. The room was big and the beds were very good. the bathroom contains lots of stuff, like toothbrush, soaps,lotions, etc. very nice. The only issue with my room is with the air conditioning that sometimes was not working perfectly. Be aware that sometimes the cleaning ladies can enter quite early in the morning in the room. But it happened only once. The check-out was done easily also, and the staff was very nice. The hotel is not in the center but you can reach in approx 20 min in the center by metro. It is convenient that you can go in any direction of the city, by having the metro and the bus in front of the hotel. From airport you need to take the ticket and a supplement, it costs around 2 euros and few cents. I would recommend this hotel but if you are the type of person that needs to be in the center of town and in the center of noise, this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel with superb transport links”
Reviews.Author: procopeo
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is a bit far from the main tourist sights you can easily reach them by the Metro just outside the hotel, a mere 30 seconds walk. This Metro station, Plaza de Castilla is a main transport hub in Madrid, so access to the city centre is 20 minutes or so, and to the airport is 15/20 minutes in a well maintained underground. That´s was why we choose it: we just wanted a confortable place to spend the night before a long haul flight. And it did the job rather well: smooth and kind check in, spacious rooms with huge beds, clean bathrooms and a 20 minute metro ride to the airport. But if you are mainly sightseeing you should consider a closer place to the city centre or a more interesting and typical neiughbourhood, where you could taste a better Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly but not el cheapo”
Reviews.Author: valleypieman
Reviews.Content: First ever visit to the Spanish capital. The Abba Casilla Plaza is located in the business sector not to far from the British Embassy. Its a clean, comfortable hotel but not the cheapest. I found the staff helpful and friendly. The rooms are very clean, comfortably and have all amenities you would expect , bath, shower, hair dryer, ironing press, bidet, safe, comfortable beds and I must say soundproof as well. Towels were replaced everyday and the room cleaned. There is a fridge in the room full of goodies[drinks, chocolate] but be warned they charge an arm and a leg for anything you drink or eat. The hotel restaurant is very expensive and personally do not think the meals are worth the cost. We ate in on the first night only, after that we ate out as you can get 2 meals out for the price of one in the hotel. Taxi's in Madrid are not cheap and sometimes we found they were taking advantage and travelling via longer routes than they should. Once you get your bearings use the fantastic metro system, there is a station across the road from the hotel [in the bus station] and for one euro you can travel miles. We would get on at Plaza Castilla and travel to the heart of the city [station Sol] you will come out in the hustle and bustle of the shopping area. Madrid has some wonderful architecture and various old buildings well worth visiting. On leaving we used the metro to travel back to the airport it cost us 2 euros each and comes out in the heart of the terminal. One final point be aware Madrid's weather is totally different from coastal Spain, its very hot in summer and but can be very cold in winter months. It was around 9 degrees when we were there whereas the Costas were showing between 18/20 degrees that 's the big difference.

Reviews.Title: “Find another place to stay, the staff is rude!”
Reviews.Author: gorditosan
Reviews.Content: The room we checked into did not have a working air-conditioner. The staff at the desk told us to just wait it will come on. It never came on and the attitude of the staff got progressively worse. After the maintenance man repaired the air we left town for three days. On our return we were given a room quite like a closet with two beds. The same staff people told us that was the ONLY room available, even though they checked in several people after us. Our reservations had been made four weeks in advance. Their was no reason for us to have "the last" room in the hotel, except for the fact that we asked repeatedly that the air be fixed earlier in the week. Luckily we had cancellation rights til six PM. The next morning we checked out and moved across the street. There is a fabulous hotel across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but everything costs extra”
Reviews.Author: luitome
Reviews.Content: I have been here in August, the location of the hotel is quite away from Madrid centre, and if you want wifi you have to pay 16 €/24h and to park your car 18€/day. The breakfast is also also extra and it costs about 16€, which is not worth the money....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic breakfast! But no food until 20:30!”
Reviews.Author: Little-Fruit-Bat
Reviews.Content: Abba Castilla Plaza is a reasonably-priced business hotel in a good location. I stayed in the executive room a couple of weeks. The service was very good, laundry came back with a nice scent of flowers, the Spanish ham and the bread served at breakfast was of exceptional quality (I loved the olive bread). The only no-no is that they do not have 24h room service. Before 20:30 it's almost impossible to get anything to eat. The food is very good though, so it's definitely worth waiting.

Reviews.Title: “excellent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: blueg3org3
Reviews.Content: the staff was excellent - very helpful. the rooms were surprisingly large and roomy. the king-sized bed was comfortable. i love the bathroom - its a 5-star bathroom! it was very clean, and clean-smelling. it had a complete toiletry kit for guests that i haven't seen in a hotel in a long while - aside from the customary lotion and shower cap, it had feminine kit, toothbrush/toothpaste, floss, shaving kit, etc. they also provided bathrobes and slippers for our use. the shower was fantastic! the hotel is close to the Metro, and it only took 10 minutes to get to the heart of Madrid. very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Good value - great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: travel4workandplay
Reviews.Content: Good location - about a 15 minute taxi into the true centre of Madrid. Perfect hotel to stay at if you want to go and watch a Real Madrid gama at the Bernabau (10/15 minute walk). Loads of taxis around hotel and close to metro station. Room fine but 2 single beds - no major issue. Internet is very expensive - 4.5 euros for 45 minutes. Breakfast is best thing about hotel - great choice and nice quality. Good business hotel apart from expensive internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and close to the metro!”
Reviews.Author: Lovestotravel_8
Reviews.Content: Hotel is rather non-descript, but is clean! The location is excellent--very short walk to the metro. The northern train station of Chamartin is very close (use this train station if planning a day trip to Segovia). We stayed in the room with our daughter, a little cramped, but okay. Breakfast was decent--quite a variety.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but i'v experienced better”
Reviews.Author: newbury2003
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night while away on business. The hotel is siuated in a convenient area close to the central bus station and near the underground. I had a 5th floor room and found it to be a little on the small side. Although it contained all the usual expectations (desk, mini bar, TV etc) everything was packed tightly into a small space making it very difficult to relax. The hotel is OK for a one night stay, especially if you travelling on business. If your visiting Madrid for the weekend then I would suggest that you look elsewhere unless you need the location or the price is right

Reviews.Title: “Small room, naff breakfast”
Reviews.Author: philsayer
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business for four nights, in what must be the smallest single room for this class of hotel in the known world. Hotel was full (so they must be doing plenty right!) so no better room could be offered. Restaurant has a pretentious dinner menu with few choices, and was virtually deserted - not surprising. I ate there just the once. Buffet breakfast is OK if you just want cold meats and/or bread and pastries, but they claim to offer a hot breakfast as well. Their idea of "hot" is at odds with mine; one small heat lamp will simply not keep five dishes even remotely warm, a phenomenon they cheerfully demonstrate each day. I played smart one morning and waited for the arrival of a fresh plate of fried eggs from the kitchen - unbelievably, they were stone cold, as if they'd been cooked the night before and refrigerated. The a/c in the room was broken when I arrived - a techie bloke arrived amazingly quickly, literally within five minutes, and fixed it using the mat from the bathroom floor and a coathanger (no, I am not kidding.) Wi-fi worked well and was remarkably cheap compared to most hotels. To be fair, I didn't try any of their other facilities, which may well be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: indaheezy
Reviews.Content: First time in Madrid and stayed in this hotel per a Spanish friend's recommendation. We were pleased with the location, not in the center of Madrid but close enough where the Metro line across the street from the hotel can take u downtown in 15 mins. It was great as we were away from the hustling bustling of tourists and party goers. The hotel offered a soothing ambiance with a jacuzzi, steam, sauna on the top floor. Higher floors has a nice big window view of the city. Bus line are right across the streets and we relied on the buses late nights when the metro was closed. I would stay here again. Prices are worth it for this hotel compared to downtown location. It's clean, it's comfortable, and yes, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Domhnall
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Castilla Plaza for one night on a business trip. The hotel is easily accessible from the airport - I was in my room within 30 minutes of leaving the airport by taxi - though the location is somewhat distant from the city centre and the main tourist areas. However, metro services to the nearby Plaza de Castilla station are good. The area around the hotel is non-descript, and somewhat dominated by the bus station immediately outside the main entrance. Internally, the atmosphere is pleasant and staff helpful. Rooms are satisfactory, if unremarkable, for a four star establishment. Dining facilities are similarly satisfactory. However at a room rate of €115 per night, it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RiaW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business and although I spent hardly any time there it seemed a very nice modern hotel, with lovely room and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Pollution”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Situated on the most polluted square in Madrid, overlooking the busy bus station (more fumes). Front desk staff unhelpful. Lobby cramped, usually crowded with coach parties coming and going. Rooms OK, spacious, well appointed. Not worth its four star rating

Reviews.Title: “Great for the football”
Reviews.Author: b737
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night which cost about £53 (double with single occupancy) through Octopus. The purpose of the visit was purely to attend a football match at the Bernabeu and from that point of view it was extremely convenient. Close to the metro, 15-20 min walk in a straight line to the stadium.Couldn't fault the hotel - modern reception,efficient, spotless room not huge but adequate. Buffet breakfast was fine with a selection of hots and colds.Nice lobby bar with beer at a reasonable €2.It's well away from the main attractions in Madrid but a perfect choice for a Bernabeu visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: YUNI
Reviews.Content: 1.location castilla plaza metro : from 50m charmartin train station : from 500m 2.find it's easy to find this hotel cause just near by big twin building(70th floor) 3.breakfast great. but not so great 4. safety, clean, information center in hotel 5. 10min walk to Flamango bar. You can reservation information center in hotel.also get a map
